name: Junior Wolff
text:
Purchase a true TaoTao 125 ATV as well as a Kayo 150. They exceeded what the previous dealer in TX sent me..

We went trail riding yesterday and these youth sized atv’s went everywhere that the adult 1000 cc plus atv’s went. Even 3’ of water.

Impressive.

Don’t buy a Chinese bike over the internet that you cannot see, touch or test or you may be like me. Bait and switch and now fighting with the online dealer to take them back.

2 Wheel Heaven had exactly what I needed and now the boys are happy .

That is what counts.

name: Jorge Vega
text: Nice place to buy a car

name: tim parker
text: Good service, but wanna price like a dealership. $75 to patch a rear tire. Ouch!

resp.text: We don't patch tires. And we've been in business for 20 years. And our technicians have more experience than any dealership within 100 miles. We aren't the cheapest but we are the best.

name: Laron Langford
text: I paid 580 and he did nothing suppose to take somewhere else you should know a axle bent before barron have the receipt he didnt have a problem collecting money use another atv repair it was a bad job they did for that much money two weeks turned to month and a half and who dont check axle before baron any key fits in it my kids four wheeler cranks it so anyone could us a key to get bad service

resp.text: I've never worked on this guys unit. Obviously this is a family member of Jamaya Langford. Jamaya paid my for the work we did $580. And declined the axle repair. I SHOULD MENTION FOR POSSIBLE SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.  JAMAYA ARGUED AT EVERY ESTIMATE AND TIME FRAME. Businesses BEWARE!!!

name: Trinnie Faith (Tt)
text: terrible service and very unprofessional. save yourself the headache

resp.text: We have never spoke to you or serviced anything for you. Google once again allows reviews of none customers but expects companies to pay them for advertising. Pretty pathetic to say the least.

name: Cory Dunaway
text: I took my VT600 there for fork seals and said check all spark plugs and replace if needed while it is there. I get it back and noticed they only replaced 2. I called and asked why and was told my bike only has 2 spark plugs. (it has 4) I'm not sure what kind of mechanic can't identify 4 plugs and wires, but they've lost my future business. And the story by the owner about only having 2 in stock was never given to me until this Google review went up. Do better work and you won't get negative reviews. Not everyone wants to bring their bike back twice for something that was simple and should have been done the first time.

resp.text: Customer Brings in Vt 600 for fork seals and spark plugs. We only had 2 spark plugs instock. So we changed the primary plugs so he could enjoy this beautiful fall weather.  We had to order the other 2 plugs.  Customer is unsatified that he has to bring bike back to replace seconday plugs at no charge.  We only charged the customer for the 2 plugs we installed. We apologized for the inconvience.  Google and their reveiws leave me speechless to how easy an unreasonable customer can down grade your rating of your company.  Pretty pathetic GOOGLE!

name: Jamaya Langford
text: Spent 500$ on repairs and still didn’t fix it tore my lights up under the four wheeler up

resp.text: Lights and issues that where fixed where a liability both to the customer and my business.  The lights where rigged and a fire hazard. Mr. Langford ask us to fix a key switch initially that estimate was $240. We fixed the keys switch and then Mr Langford ask us to change the oil and to check to see if the rim was bent. Upon inspection we noticed that the wheel was fine but the bearing carrier was crack and bearings where bad. .  We replaced the cracked bearing carrier and bad bearings $240 parts and labor. Only to find that the axle was bent. When the axle was advised and the estimate of $250 parts and labor was given. Unfortanetly he declined and took the ATV else where.  I SHOULD MENTION FOR POSSIBLE SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.  JAMAYA ARGUED AT EVERY ESTIMATE AND TIME FRAME. Businesses BEWARE!!!

name: Gene Lineberry
text: Did a good job on my busa 👍

name: Micah Cantrell
text: Bought an atv for my daughter today. They answered all my questions. They were very friendly and professional and not condescending at all (I an very ignorant about small engines (or any engine for that matter). They showed me everything I needed to know about simple maintenence and storage and even helped me load it in my truck. I've been to several places today, and they won my business with being knowledgeable, friendly, and they had the best price. I hope to use them in the future for my service needs. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you and Merry Christmas

text: Great place for all sxs needs.

resp.text: Thank you

text: Very helpful guys with the best prices!

name: Montavvos Edwards
text: I had a very good experience

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Edwards

name: Joseph
text: These guys installed a clutch kit as well as a couple of other things. Very professional and the turn around time from when we dropped it off to when we picked it up was so fast. We highly recommend and we will bring our RZR back here.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Dustin Robbins
text: 20 years in business and it shows.

name: Jon Stebbins
text: Took a go cart there had a used stator put on for 100 dollars. Talked to the mechanic and guy at the front about putting a new carb on when I went to pick it up, He (mechanic) shows me a new carb tells me 50 for the carb and 50 for labor mind you the other guy was sitting there talking with us about it. So a week later I take it back to get the carb put on and when I go pick it up they charge me 204 dollars. The same guy tells me I must have misunderstood and the labor was 100. So why is it 204 I asked. Well he cleaned out the gas tank also he says. I had already cleaned the gas tank out and replaced all the gas lines and filter before I took it up there. This place is a ripoff. Over priced and will do bs work that you don’t ask for just so they can charge you more.

name: Joseph Morgan
text: Great guys to deal with. Great service and good deals.

name: Apoth3cary
text: I asked to replace front sprocket and they replaced rear. Took over a month for a chain and sprocket. Got the bike back with no gas. High price for barely adequate job.

resp.text: We have your worn out rear sprocket and chain here at our shop for you to come look at. And changing the sprocket does not include a free tank of fuel. Your front sprocket was approved by the technician as ok.  And your bike sat here at the shop 8 days after we called it completed. Safe travels Sir.

name: Gary Whitlock
text: Initially the work was good, quick and a fair price, just called and told them the fuel line they installed split, just told me the size it was, auto parts store said it was a vacuum line, not a fuel line, guess I'll have to figure it out for myself

resp.text:
We supplied the most reasonable solution. Displaying common sense. If you'd liked we could've asked you to spend the same 50 cents to drive to us and we would have given you  a fuel line after we ordered it We where out of stock that day. I assumed it would be just as easy for you to stop at a parts store and grab a fuel line. I do apologize that your 50 cent fuel line spilt we hope you where able to figure it out by your lonesome
.

name: jonathan croley
text: Dustin has always answered any questions I have had and gives honest advice . Best prices you’ll find and he will stand behind his products.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Jeremy Woodall
text: Best in the business! I've had them work on four wheelers, seadoo and my motorcycle. If you want it fixed and fixed right, bring them whatever you got!

resp.text: Thank you Jeremy.

text:

name: Jason Hubbard
text: These guys are AMAZING! They are extremely knowledgeable about all of the products they sell and the services they offer. I was very surprised at the hometown feel of the shop and the friendliness of everyone there. They are able to take care of any tire needs you have from high performance cars to rock crawling 4 wheel drives. The shop is set up to handle any and all off road performance needs that anyone can have. It is very easy for me to say that after my experience with this wonderful group of gentleman that I will never go anywhere to buy tires again. I was impressed enough with them that my search for a Jeep to build is in high gear now. I'm looking forward to seeing what they can do with it. The best advice I can give to everyone is to check them out for any and all tire needs.

name: Dennis Gilliam
text: Bought a PWC from my neighbor knowing it had taken on a lot of water. I tried to piddle with it but decided that I needed to let an expert handle it since water had gotten in the motor. I had some bad luck with previous PWC mechanics in the area so I was apprehensive. Fred at Advanced Watercraft took it in and diagnosed several issues. It was back running in a week. Me and my kids took it out the day we picked it up and by the end of the day it had taken on water again. WAIT! I know it sounds like they didn't fix it, but I took it back to Fred and AW- he was apologetic and accommodating. Turns out in addition to the items he had fixed, a previous mechanic had routed some water lines incorrectly and caused an additional water issue. Although it was not his fault, Fred insisted that he would fix the boat and he did it at no charge. This type of commitment to service is rare these days. Advanced Watercraft and Fred have earned my business as long as I own a PWC. I strongly recommend this company!

resp.text: Thanks for your review!  We pride ourselves on quality work.

Yamaha has the #1 rating in customer satisfaction and after owning a slew of Hondas and Suzukis, I now know why. When two of my bikes had minor recall issues, TCY took care of the issues very quickly. I live almost an hour away. Having them work with me on appointment times, etc... was a real plus.

name: Melissa L
text:
Stopped by this place to look at the little 4 wheelers that they had sitting outside.   The price on the tag of the blue webbed little 4 wheeler was $695.00.   Went inside and inquired about other that they had inside and some had a sticker price for $995.00 and $695.00 same style 4 wheelers.   Ask lady behind the counter why the price difference and she couldn't give a straight answer then proceeded to say that the OWNER wrote a 6 instead of 9 and they were $995.00 not $695.00 as written on the tags of the others.  Then the gentleman that was behind the counter came out on the showroom floor and says "OH NO I CANT SELL THEM FOR THAT AND I CANT EVEN BUY THEM FOR THAT PRICE and proceeded to snatch the price tags off the ones that had a tag marked $695.00 on them in front of us.    Ask if he would sell for the price that was on it prior to him snatching the price tag off and he RUDELY said NO.  I am a small business owner myself, and would never have done this to a customer, especially pulling off price tags in front of a customer and telling them I can't honor the price tag that is on the item because of a mistake that was made by the owner of the busiess.  Honor the price that is on the tag and then correct the price issue after the customer has left the busines.
So buyer beware of this place of business.

resp.text: I'm sorry you feel the need to try to hurt our business due to a small error. I'm happy you brought it to our attention and we have corrected the issue. We are a small business and sometimes mistakes are made. We can't afford to sell merchandise at a loss. We have a perfect reputation in our community and customer service will always be number 1. So thank you for stopping by, and we hope you find what you are looking for elsewhere.

name: Predator Hollywood
text:
Had been looking for a motor scooter for my 14 year old grandson; happened to see KMG on Facebook (gotta love that "free" advertising !!) and decided to check it out.  Upon arrival, saw displayed exactly the type of motor scooter we were looking for - and also saw this tall guy in a sun hat who greeted us.  Joe was EXTREMELY gracious, knowledgeable, friendly and laid back - he's just like a longtime friend that you haven't seen in awhile!  We decided on a white Wolf, full face helmet and alarm system.  The purchase process was very smooth and easy.  Joe answered all our questions and concerns and assured us that delivery could be expected in a few days.  Sure enough, 4 days later we returned to pick up the Wolf - it was all prepared and ready to go - just as Joe assured us it would be.  My grandson was so excited!  After break-in, we returned the Wolf to Joe for fluid changes and adjustments and again had a most pleasurable experience; the maintenance took only a few minutes; Joe even provided my grandson with several shaded sun shields.  It is with a great deal of pleasure and considerable pride that I highly recommend KMG Powersports and Joe Berrer and his staff to any and all who are in the market for a powersport.  You, too, will undoubtedly have the same pleasurable experience(s) that we had!
Joe Drop
Semmes, AL

name: Maria McSherry
text:
The sales experience was great! No complaints.

My garage kept, babied ATV with less than 22 hours on it started experiencing issues in May 2020. After researching the issue in case it was a simple fix, I requested a service appointment, and after several days I finally received a call stating they were behind. Fast forward to now almost 2.5 months later and every time I call to schedule the service, I’m told is that service department is behind, and they’ll get to me. That is too long for a service appointment. It makes me question how good the products really are...What good is the extended warranty if you can’t use it? My ATV is basically new and I can’t ride it. I will never purchase a Polaris product again.

resp.text: Sorry for the unusual experience.  We understand the frustrations of vehicle down-time, and work hard to shorten the time it takes to get your vehicle repaired when it does have issues.  We did have you scheduled for an appointment to bring your vehicle to us on May 18th and when you did not show we attempted to contact you to reschedule.  Since we did not hear from you we assumed the issues with your ATV were no longer a problem.  If your ATV still needs service, please contact us and we will be happy to get you back on the schedule for the next available appointment.

name: Nickolas Shrewsbury
text: Great Service. Got a new rzr they had us in and out within a hour. Wonderful people.

resp.text: Thanks Nickolas!  We appreciate your business!

name: James Toquero
text: Great customer service! The crew at Champion Powersports will  definitely take care of you. Purchased a Polaris XP 1000 and couldn’t be happier! Thank you

resp.text: Thanks James for the positive review of CHAMPION POWERSPORTS. We appreciate you taking time to leave your feedback and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Lance Borner

resp.text: Thanks Lance!  Hope to see you again soon....

name: Angie Porterfield
text:
If you are looking for an off road vehicle (atv, side by side) this is the first place to look. There was no pressure to buy today. Only the desire to listen so that could find the right machine for our needs and not the most expensive thing on the lot. Our salesman Spencer and the rest of the knowledgeable staff was able to answer every question that we had. The Staff also treated my wife with the respect that lacks in other dealer experiences . We left that day feeling like we have gotten a great deal and amazed at how friendly and respectful the staff is. We cannot say enough great things about the buying experience through Champion Powersports. The parts department has also been very knowledgeable and courteous while helping with parts and accessories for our ATV. The Polaris 570 utility edition that we purchased could not have been a better choice for our needs. This ATV has no trouble pulling the 950 pound trail mower we use on the farm or putting that smile on your face at the end of a hard days work . The 570 has more than enough power for the tough jobs or excitement out on the trail. The best way to describe the Polaris 570 utility edition and Champion Powersports is simple. The right tool for the job. Thank you to everyone at Champion for what you do.
Matthew Porterfield

name: Bradley Owens
text:
Robert and Brink are my go-to guys. Even though, Xtreme Offroad Ind. LLC (me) and Champion Powersports are competitors in our profession, every time I need to refill my supply shelf with Polaris specific maintenance items, or need to order specialty parts, I go see them. Usually you'll never hear of another powersport repair shop praising competition, but again these guys help me when I need it most.

I sometimes order parts that are on back-order or out-of-stock, but Jeff and the parts guys can usually get me fixed up somehow by working some magic! I ordered a crankshaft that was 3 months out on back-order and somehow they got it in 2 weeks. That is true customer service!

Again, Jeff, Robert, Brink, I appreciate you guys and whenever I need more Polaris supplies you'll be where I go first!

text: Very Racist/Dishonest Company, will never go back again & I wouldn’t advise anybody else to go either. they claimed that it was a state law that you had to be 21 or older to purchase a atv. name: Michael Snowden
text: What a refreshing  experience I had at Powersports Service Center. I had a horrible experience down the street at a large dealer who kept my Honda Rancher for two months the first time to replace the carburetor and flush the fuel tank. After I finally picked it up I took off to Ohio on a week long hunting trip only to have it ruined by a carburetor that wasn’t installed properly. Matter of fact the 4 bolts that attach the carburetor were barely  finger tight causing fuel to leak into my air filter chamber. I came home and took it back for another 6 to 8 weeks and had to go sit in the waiting room to have someone actually work on my unit.   A week later after finally picking up my Rancher it wouldn’t crank. A friend told me about Powersports Service Center and  Chuck and the team were amazing. My unit was fixed in three days and the real problem was found and corrected immediately. My Rancher runs perfectly now cranking with the slightest touch of the starter. Powersports Service Center will be the only people who ever  work on my equipment from now on. Oh yeah, the price was very reasonable to top it off. Thank you Chuck!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much. Glad we could resolve your issue.

name: Jacob Bare
text: Dropped off a bike I got for my Nephew to have 2 tires put on the bike and was quoted $30 per tire. Went to pick it up and they said it was $178. They also charged me for 2 new tubes I didn’t need or ask for. I brought a new one in a box I already had that was purchased there. When I asked for a breakdown the owner became instantly rude and just out right nasty. “Don’t buy one if you can’t afford the maintenance”. Then the other worker went and got the tech and said come here this guy is complaining and then said he’d roll it in the back and take it off. That’s were I put my foot down. The tech was the only person in there with a level head about him. I tried taking it to Dothan Power Sports 1st but the we’re too busy to get it in and out today. No customer service skills whatsoever. I literally thought I was going to end up in the parking lot with the 2nd guy and I wasn’t even dealing with him. I definitely will not be back.

resp.text: We’re sorry that your experience didn’t go as expected. The $30 per tire was a labor only quote that was made clear at the time the unit was quoted. Customer requested two new tires and when the tech disassembled the bike, noticed it was missing key safety strips on the rim, one tube was deteriorated, and replaced out of safety concern and the longevity of the repair. The additional items and Alabama mandatory tire sales fee were the only charges the customer wasn’t aware of. The customer was phoned to be informed, but didn’t  answer the phone during the servicing, so that we could make him aware of the extra needed items.  When the customer arrived to pick up the unit, and was presented the repair bill, he was adamant that he wasn’t going to pay for the extra items, so it was offered to remove the items and return his original equipment.  In the end the shop owner marked down the cost of the repair and the shop gave the customer a free tube to help ease the cost of the repair. It was noted to the customer when he was there, that we can’t estimate all unforeseen things needed in a repair until the actual job was being performed.

They said they cleaned out gas tank which they didn't, I've had to do it myself since I got it home. Won't ever take it back to them because they over charged me at $800 to do very little work and didn't do everything they said they did! Charge me 300% mark up on aftermarket parts. I was alarmed at the prices of parts and labor for such little work and then it not being done properly. Suggestion's, Make sure you get prices out front before they work on your bike!!!( The Mule work was in the name of Tim Hudson, check your work orders again! He Lives in Blakely Ga.)

resp.text:
Mr. Hutchins,
I reviewed our service repair tickets all the way back to June 2018, and we do not show ever working on a unit for you, listed as Jim Hutchins. Could you possibly be confusing our shop with Dothan Powersports(considering they sale and service Kawasaki product)?  If so, please kindly delete this unfavorable review of our facility, or inform us  to whom this unit was registered, for repair on the repair invoice, and date it entered the facility.

Jody Spann

name: Ted
text: Was quoted 6000 dollars on a  bike with an msrp rating of 4800. I recommend driving to Ozark to Beasleys Kawasaki. That is just outrageous. I was also quoted 5000 dollars on bikes that were between 3,500 - 4000 dollars most other places. I said I was a new rider, not an idiot.

resp.text: Mr. Conner. We never presumed you to be an idiot,  but you have to also understand business are different independent franchises.  Our prices at the time you visited this dealership reflected the total price out the door with all applicable state and local taxes and freight charges for the particular unit you were interested in. At this particular time we also has packaged prices for machines that included 5 years worth of warranty, jacket, helmet, and gloves. When you call different dealers in different areas they have the ability to quote you a machine at a lesser price and once your in the closing office they introduce the total price including the added fees. Something you overlook when ranting about our prices in this review, I'm sure.  The same goes for where you choose to purchase your auto, boat, or RV. Its called free enterprise and I hope you understand that ranting about it doesn't change what made this country great. Thank you!

text: Told me out would cost $300-400. Picked It up and it was $600. Now I'm selling my bike for parts. Go to Beasley's.

resp.text:
Greg,
Sorry this may have happened, unfortunately I don't have much in the way of information on your particular situation based on your unfavorable review.

As with an estimated guess,  looking at the crystal ball of problems, there is no way to accurately predict all situations, until the work is being performed. As well as, when a customer drops off a machine and doesn't complete reveal the entire back story. This may not be the case in this particular situation, but in many instances maintenance becomes a can of worms, and if the machine is to work properly (for which it was brought to the dealership) there are additional things to be performed. If those are not addressed, it can cause an unsafe machine and therefore cost yourself and the dealership more in the long run. We hope that you understand maintenance isn't an exact science.

text: My husband and I bought not just one but two little four wheelers for our kids,   I had been shopping g around d we got a fair price for them.  The reason for my one star, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!  My kids wore down the brakes, I don't think they were hard on them, or our brake light is working.  We called while they were under warranty.  It took two weeks to get back about parts.  At that point the parts were out of warranty.  So we paid for them and shipping.  We got the wrong parts.  I even took picture the second time.  We got parts that look similar but size was wrong, would not work.  So Mailed them back along w one of the brake pads off the 4 wheeler and tracked them..  I found out that the package was delivered Thursday 4/28 .  I called and was told spouse was sick bit she sent picture to manufacture.  No call that we got them, they are working on it,, nothing.  This has been the way we have been treated.  You have to chase them down to get answers.  I asked to be called by the end of the week, with answers and a solution!  I haven't been able to ride our 4 wheelers since early March!  It's May 2nd!  It's not like we got these for free and didn't pay for replacement parts or shipping!

name: Daniel Callins
text: I am so happy I found this place. I purchased a Hammerhead 250ss go cart second hand and when I purchased it, it would turn over but not start. The owner said the he let the go cart sit up for a year, but it did run but was pretty sure the carburetor needed cleaning. I took it to Basch Brothers in Cullman, because this is where the cart was originally purchased. I told them that I wanted to get the carburetor cleaned  and to look over the go cart for anything else it needed. They called me the next day and said it had no compression. I told them that's odd because when I purchased the cart, I checked the compression and it was at 90lbs. They said I don't know what to tell you but we are only get 60lbs. AT this point I understood they didn't want to work on it and I picked it up and took it to Dr. Joe's in Ensley. They found the carburetor was gumed up and the vacuum line. They return the go cart to me  the next day completely fixed. The fee was only $115 and the work was completed quicker than I expected.

name: Cathy Young
text: We drove 2.5 hours to purchase our beautiful, new Can Am Spyder RT Sea to Sky from this dealership and it was well worth it. From the very get go, Bree was amazing and straight forward.  We knew what we needed and wanted and she was able to give us it at a price that worked for us. Bree and the team here give: 1) true up front, out the door pricing, 2) a fair amount for trades, 3) no hassle financing and 4) great service all the way around. We appreciated the honesty she gave us from the get go knowing we had been working with another dealership. She never bad mouthed them or tried anything sneaky (can’t say the same for the Big #1) to win our business. She beat them in price and overall customer service. Casey, in finance, was able to get us a deal we could work with, warranties and services we needed and our financing approved quickly. When we arrived everything, to include our bike, was ready to go. When parts we were expecting were not immediately found, Tim, the General Manager, stepped in and started looking and found the part. From first phone call to driving away on our bike, it was a wonderful experience.

name: Doug Loveless
text: The staff are wonderful, Bree was very professional and knowledgeable enjoyed working with her. Casey was witty and made the financing quick and easy. The whole process was slick. Would recommend them to anyone who wants a quick and painless transaction. Thank you

Mr. Loveless, reviews like this give us motivation and help us ensure we provide high-quality care. Your recommendation means so much to us and we're so happy to have earned it. Thank you again for taking the time to let the world know about your positive experience. Have a great day!Welcome to the largest family in the Southeast the Motorcycle Sports Family.

text: I had been dealing with another dealership in AL but I could never get the salesman that I was assigned to on the phone. I started looking elsewhere and came across Motorcycle Sports and gave them a call and talked to Dwight and he had what I was looking for. Within a few hours Dwight and Kim had me ready to go. They held the unit for me until I could there. I made a 2.5 hr drive and Kim had all paperwork ready to go. Dwight showed me the unit and explained the features and I was ready to go. I also found out 2 days before heading out that a friends uncle has purchased a unit from here a few weekends prior and had a great experience. Dwight and Kim and a few other staff members told me a about a few local riding spots. I highly recommend this dealership and will go back when its time for another one.

text:
**SHADY EBAY SELLER**

This outfit does not honor binding pricing agreements. They cancelled my order because the selling price was apparently too low, only to turn around and relist the same part for much higher. I can only imagine what goes on inside the business if the dishonesty pervades the online portal.

Consider yourself warned.

name: James Gatlin
text:
I brought in two motorcycles, one had a good motor and the other a blowed motor. I asked that he put the good motor on the good bike. We had a gentleman's agreement that I would pay more than a thousand dollars, and that would include two new tires. After looking closer at the tires I had I found that I had two good tires between the two bikes. I tried calling to check on the progress on my bike, but wasn't able to speak with anyone. Phill, the owner tells me, when I went in to check on my bike, that they got trash in my carbs. He had the carbs off my bike and was supposedly cleaning them. When he called me and told me my bike was ready I picked it up and only two cylinders was firing, the clutch was slipping, and the carbs were pouring gas. I took it back  the same day under the 30 day warranty to have it properly fixed. When he called me that my bike was ready and I went to pick it up he tries to charge me another $350.00. I called the police out to try and get my bike, but they said they couldn't get invovled and I would have to pay the money or get an attorney. I didn't trust him to leave my bike any longer, so paid the money to get my bike. My bike is sitting in my yard with the carbs still flooding out. After more than $1,400 dollars spent and I still can't drive my bike. If you value your property, do not take it to Prattville power sports. I'm getting an attorney and going to court.

Today June 4, 2019, I had the pleasure of meeting the new owners of Prattville power sports. I had bought a new battery from phill when he done the work on my bike. Today I found out that the battery he put in my bike wasn't the same battery he said he put in. That it was a cheaper version, but he charges me for the more expensive battery. The new owner pulled out the old bills and showed me the difference and then gave me the battery that I was suppose to have from the beginning. I now believe and tmhave complete trust in the new owners and plan to do my business with them now that I know phill is gone. Thank you Prattville power sports.

name: Mike Fisher
text: This dealer is taking advantage of customers during a time when production has been slow due to the pandemic. They misrepresented several things to us. We were told they have to pay Honda MSRP so their only way to make any money was to charge us a $1600 freight and bolt charge. That is simply not true. They also tried to sell us a maintenance plan saying the first maintenance required on the machine we were considering would cost $500. We discovered this maintenance was simply changing the oil and spark plugs which can easily be done by me for a material cost of $65. We had a UTV we took to get a possible trade in value on and after having their service department look at it came out with a long list of work it needed and offered us a RIDICULOUSLY low offer of $1850. We took that machine to a mechanic later and it required a tune up that cost me $150 and I sold it for $6000. Not only are they gouging people on pricing they are being dishonest while doing it.  Needless to say we did not buy anything here. Won’t go back and won’t recommend. Bought the machine they quoted us for $3000 less at a dealer in Mississippi. Well worth the drive to get it. Shop around. Call them. Honda of Laurel. Great honest folks.

name: Eric Larson
text:
I would be careful relying on the reviews by folks with 1 or 2 total reviews and no profile ect. More than likely fake accounts made to influence the rating on Google.  Look though the reviews of those with real accounts.

We had mixed experiences. It seems it depends on the mood of the sales folks if they want to be fair or try to score on a huge markup on a sale.

You will find “internet” pricing on many of their products and that price seems fair compared to other shops. The problem is when they give you the “out the door” price you will see they jack up the “fees” to more than make up for that good price.

They matched another dealer on our first purchase.    When I wanted to buy a second machine they quoted almost $7,000 out the door on a $4,697 internet priced motorcycle with original msrp $5,299.   $1,700  in “fees” plus taxes.

Just be aware of the hard sale tactics and watch the dealer fees.  They also want you to buy the massive markup warrantee and finance at 15-25%.  They actually don’t seem to want cash sales.

Needless to say I drove over to Atlanta and I’ve found several dealerships much easier to deal with. We bought the same bike for way under $6,000 out the door. The crazy part is I actually ended up buying 2 bikes at the dealer in Atlanta!   My son got a new R3 and Wife got a Ninja 400.

text: Beware of bait and switch tactics! Speedzone has an Xr650l listed on Cycletrader for $6089. When I called to confirm this price I was told that that price was listed in error. A few hours later the price was increased to the standard $6999 price everyone is asking for that bike. One month later I checked back and the price is again listed for $6089! This is clearly bait and switch tactics!

name: Matt Baran
text: Thank you Stephanie Gallagher for all your help and wisdom. You made the buying and choice of which one to buy so much easier. You were very helpful and knowledgeable. Thank you again

name: Candy Mask
text: I had a great experience at Speedzone Oxford. Stephanie G. was great! She was very helpful and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend them to my friends and family. Edit- Please read all paperwork carefully before you sign! I was tired & ready to go home when they got the paperwork ready. There are charges added that I have no idea what they are! What is a “bolt on” fee??? Why did I get charged their shipping cost? I ended up financing apx $5000 more than the listed price. I know it’s my fault for not paying attention but I promise, I felt really stupid when I finally got my paperwork out & went over it...

name: All Elite Hunting&Fishing
text: Fantastic service stephanie swafford

name: Luke Henle
text: I highly recommend SpeedZone. Stephanie G was our salesperson as she was great. I tried over 20 different dealerships across the East coast and Stephanie was the only person who could get us what we wanted. The rest of Speedzone’s staff was highly professional, I would buy from them again.

name: George Adams
text: After checking all over the internet, these guys seem to have lots of machines at Great prices! Well, after driving over an hour, the did not have near what the website showed, very few machines at higher prices! I felt like it was a way for you to come in so they can try and sell you something else!  It’s kind of like false advertisement!!

name: David Wood
text: Was outside looking at bikes, had no intention of going inside due to the mask requirement and I don't wear one but was asked to come inside and then was accused of trying to spread covid and make others sick. I will NOT be going back. I'll buy my bike elsewhere

name: Edely Hammonds
text: They are wonderful people, great costumer service. My family and I are very satisfied costumer. We would like to say thank you to Stephanie S, for her great service.

name: Wayne Stowers
text: Chris and Jeremiah were extremely helpful and made it a wonderful experience out feeding us with everything we needed to protect the grandchildren and keep them safe. Wonderful experience!!!!

name: WL
text:
Not a good experience at all!
Wouldn't talk price over phone said come down and we will make it worth your while.  I live 2 hours away.  I took off work early and went to talk to them.  Needless to say they did not make it worth my while.  They wanted to run my credit without even agreeing on price. Then when I made them give me the price they were $2700 over their listed price on the website.  I told them I already had two quotes over 2k less than them for the same unit.  They acted like I was lying to them when I told them that.  We agreed to part ways at that point.  They tried to prey on me to make some money.  Don't go here unless you have quotes from other places and have done your homework.  Don't let them bait you with their low internet prices and then stack the add on charges on you in the end. Do your homework or they will prey on you!! They won't get another chance with me!!

name: Ashleigh Brook
text: I wanted to leave Speedzone in Oxford a great review for the wonderful service.  Specifically Stephanie G.  She was absolutely a great person to work with!  She made us feel welcomed and was very knowledgeable about the bike we were looking at.  She was friendly and answered all our questions!  We ended up buying our bike from her!  When I’m ready for a Monkey I’m going back to see Stephanie!  A great and hassle free experience!  Will be back for more toys! Thank you Stephanie!!!! :-)

name: Nick Morris
text: Had a Great overall buying experience. The entire staff from the lady that greeted me at the door to the parts/accessories guy was very friendly and helpful. My sales guy, Chris, had a very good sales process that was smooth and not overwhelming. He answered every concern I had. He did a great job of qualifying me to a bike that was probably more suitable for me than what I originally came to look at. The girl who did the closing paperwork (can't remember her name) was very thorough going over the contract to make sure nothing was left unanswered. Probably half the staff stayed close to 2 hours late while I was finishing the deal. Will recommend this place to my friends.

text: My husband and I drove 2 hours there yesterday after being pre approved in the middle of the week. From the moment we got there the customer service experience was awful. The Guy Chris knew exactly what ATV we were looking at. When we got there the ATV was still in the crate. After being there for over 6 hours we walked away without an ATV and the reason being is they come back with an extremely high interest rate. Basically when we did the math we would be paying over 20,000 on a $9,000.00 toy. Chris was very rude and every time a question was asked he came back with “I don’t know”. Extremely poor customer service. Then he tried to bully us into buying the ATV as he wanted to pretend he went up to bat for us during this entire process. I refuse to be treated this way. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!! They’re con artist.

text: I would love to say this was a great experience, but it wasn't. We were told that all used vehicles go through an inspection prior to resell and that they don't sell vehicles with major issues. That was a lie, they sold us a used PWC with a blown  engine and had it been ran through their mechanic as they told us it was they would have definitely known this. They LIED to make a sell which is pretty pathetic. $5,000 down the drain as I can't even get them to return a phone call. Would not recommend  the Oxford location.

text: Tyrone Green showed me great customer service. I'm was very pleased and will be using them in the future..

name: Sherri Spruill
text: My name is Sherri Spruill from Mt. Pleasant, Tx.  We have been a Honda-Kawasaki dealer here for 55 years!   We recently sold 2 Mules that are being used at the Army Depot in Anniston.  One of the units has a warranty need.  We are 10 hours away.  I called Tyron at SpeedZone, whom I have never met.  I told him my need and asked what would he suggest.  Tyron, who has nothing to gain, offered to help me get the Mule to his sister store to get the repairs done (remember, we are 10 hrs, one way to get there).  As it turns out, we decided to switch the unit for the depot and bring the problem unit back to Tx.  THE POINT IS  TYRON IN SERVICE IS WONDERFUL< AWESOME<AND OFFERED TO HELP ME IF NEEDED!!  Do not hesitate to use Tyron.  God Bless.  :-)

There was a black hair little girl about four I would guess riding a bike on the sales floor no mask. Well we are in the store about two mins when I guess it’s the manager (has a full sleeve tattoo on his left arm) walks up to us and tells us we are required to wear mask. I asked even a two and one year old. He told me yes. So we left. I guess speedzone enforces a mask policy on who they see fit to. I will carry my business else where.

text: Honestly it started great. Got approved Friday told them I'd be there Saturday to sign and pick up the ATV. Got there today only to find out they sold the unit right out from under me and then proceeded to try and sell me something $3-4000 over the one I told them I was coming to pick up. So I walked away with nothing except bad excuses on why the unit got sold. It's honestly bad business. if you have a motivated buyer why would you sell the one thing they told you they were coming to pick up?!?!

text: Victoria was amazing sales lady. Greeted me with a very warm welcome. She was very knowable on her sales. I recommend that if you go there Victoria will do her best too put you in what you are looking for.

name: Chris Lee
text: Sales people were awesome got us approved but had to fix the brand new trailer myself ( not the sales ppl fault) .. pulled off and noticed the tail light on the WaveRunner trailer was out.. turned around went to the service department those guys said they couldn't help me but told me when I got home to rewire the ground and the light should work 🙄

name: James Whitaker
text: I bought a used bike and asked if since they were the last to service the bike and since they are a dealer selling the bike if I have any problems would they be willing to honor any repairs needed the sales manager while refusing to nail down specifics advised if it is reasonable amount of time they would consider and took my check the bike had 24k miles and I drove it home at just about 25k miles and less than 30 days later I started hearing a loud ticking/rattle and the bike shakes at 60mph I called and they said for $105 they would tell me how much it would cost to fix the issue I asked if (since any buy here pay here would give 1k miles or 30 days for repairs) they might do anything to assist since I just gave them $6k they said that too much time had past. This does not scream "we stand by our products and work" but they were polite about everything so there is that I guess

name: David Champion
text: Bought two motorcycles from Stephanie. Great experience. Great team to purchase and get service from.

name: Seth Riley
text: Ordered a water heat sensor from them was told it would be 3 to 5 days shipping. Called back 5 day later and was told it was just ordered tried calling several times with the answer of let me get a tracking number and I will call you back. Here we are starting the 3rd week of never getting a call back after 5 calls and the same answer with no call back. Now they want to  charge me a restocking fee when I said give me my money back. Be careful with these people never a straite answer!! Very displeased in them!!!!!!!

name: Everett H
text: Very rude and arrogant member (Chris i think was his name.) looked down on us from the moment we walked in. Had little to no interest in trying to sell us anything we were ready to buy that day. we left from there went to Motorcycle sport in Munford  and bought a new Side by Side. (Cash I might add) either we wouldn’t buy a bucket of water from them even if I was on fire. Would give them a 0

text: Great customer service!! Tiffany and Jeremiah are wonderful!! Enjoyed meeting all the people that worked there. They are super helpful and were wonderful in getting me taken care of!! I highly recommend them!!

name: Benji Rentz
text: Great customer service

name: Trevor Knight
text:
Hands down worst customer service in my life. The prices are outrageous and the staff do not care about the customer. I asked for a help with a flat tire (kids 50cc bike) and they quoted me at $100.00 for repairing it. I told the guy it could just need air and might not need anything else, but he didn’t seem to want to air it up for me real quick to check. I then ask for a price on checking out an ATV (kids 50cc) and making sure the governor is working properly. He stated that would be $100.00 just to look at it. I told him I would put both bikes in for a full tune up service if the price was good. He stated he could do $150.00 tune up for the ATV but still would charge me an addition $100.00 to look at the governor issue. I told him that all he had to do is turn the bike on and hit the gas (in order to see if it has a governor issue). He said that is not included in the tune up (apparently they don’t start and run bikes they do tune ups on...🤷🏽‍♂️) so I would pay a total of $250.00 for just the ATV.

I have been riding bikes and visiting motorcycle shops for 25 years. Worst experience ever.

name: Shannon Lipham
text: Young Stephanie was awesome!! Thank you for the sale and being so professional and down to earth.

Not to mention, the staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, and compassionate about motorcycling!! I was introduced to the ladies in the gear/apparel department and they were very helpful and courteous!! I highly recommend you start here to save yourself time if you are in the market to buy a new motorcycle!! Thanks again to the Speedzone team in Oxford!!

name: Christina Malone
text:
DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE! THEY WILL SAY ANYTHING TYou O MAKE A SALE! THEY WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF AN INEXPERIENCED CONSUMER!

My 20 year old son purchased a Rancher with accessories including snorkel kit with Bama Power Sports. The salesman asked the service manager if installing the snorkel kit would void the warranty, the service manager said he didn't know but not to worry about it. They would fix it if it messed up. So, it was not disclosed to him that by using the accessories he purchased it could potentially void his warranty. He was however told by the salesman, in front of two witnesses, that Bama Power Sports would warranty it for 1 year "It doesn't matter if you set it on fire or run it into a lake, we will cover it".  THEY SAID WHATEVER THEY THOUGHT HE WANTED TO HEAR TO MAKE THE PURCHASE.

The first time my son took his Rancher out he used the snorkel kit. It got water in it. He looked under the 4-wheeler and there was a hose unattached. Had to be a poor install since it was the first time my son took it out. Honda Warranty will not cover it, snorkel kit, makes sense. But now Bama Power Sports is denying the salesman ever said anything about a 1 year warrant to these kids. Now I know these kids do not know anything warranties so they did not make this statement up. Bama Power Sports allowed my son to leave there thinking he was completely covered and is now refusing to make things right. $1,800 repair.

We tried to negotiate some sort of deal with them to take partial responsibility but they refused to speak to our attorney or have their attorney speak to ours. We decided we didn't trust these people enough to even work on it. When we went to pick it up they brought it out in pieces on pallets. I just hope all the parts are there. We now have to take it to someone else to fix it. Expensive way for my son to learn some places are dishonest and get everything in writing.

name: brandon cook
text: (EVERY ONE MUST READ )DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH SPEEDZONE OF OXFORD.  They advertised a sxs for one price but wrote it up for more than they advertised.not talking about the add on like extended warranty or prep fees.im talking the price on the tag for the unit. Save your self some time and money go to Motorcycle sports or Talladega cycle. Speedzone is already over priced. They sold my wife a used rzr for 2500 more than what it would cost new and it was bone stock.(extra b.s) so after taking our Polaris to have serviced thru there speed pass.this is ruffy 1 year later cause hey I paid for why not use it. Well let's start off by saying this is the 3rd time the ploaris has been in for service.so dropped it off on a Tuesday and they tell me it will be ready on the next day. So the next day rolls around and I do not get a call to come pick it up. So the next day Thursday I call them and ask if it's ready to be picked up. They informed me yes it is ready. So let's load the trailer and go to pick it up.once getting there they hand me paper work and he goes to find my sxs. He is walking around everywhere in the shop to find this sxs. So I look at the paperwork and it is paperwork for a Honda i used to own not the Polaris so I tell him it's the ploaris not the Honda due to the Honda being in Texas now. They then go on to tell me that they just completeld the work on my Honda.so that's when I decided to let him know that it's in Texas. But yet they did the service and paperwork.once we found our ploaris we were told it would be ready the next day. So moving on to next day we get there to pick up the machine thsy has 150 hrs on it and they only do a 25 hr service on the machine. They cant tell me how many services it has had even tho they did it. So there goes our warranty  and extended warranty. Man this place is the biggest joke ever. For anyone to buy from them and give a good review. They must be standing by your side telling you what to write before you leave there store.

text: FYI. Speed zone motor sports does not do service work on anything over 10 years old. I called about having the electronic shift looked at on my rancher 350. The lady said we are backed up so it will be a couple weeks before I can get to it. I told her that would be fine I wasn’t in a hurry that I just needed it before hunting season. She said bring it down. So I spent 20-30 minutes hooking up the trailer and loading the 4-wheeler and 45 minutes driving down there. Just to find out they will not work on my 2005 rancher. Let me be clear, I’m not upset that they wouldn’t service my atv. I’m upset that about 3 hours of my Saturday had been wasted and could’ve been avoided by simply telling me their policy over the phone. And the fact that the lady acted as though I had wasted her time. When in actually I feel as though my time was wasted. I’ve bought several parts and dealt with Bama Power sports service dept before this interaction with no problems whatsoever. Not to mention Bama Power Sports seemed to be thankful for my business. I’ve never left feeling as though I wasted their time. I was concerned when I saw management was changing but with all the good reviews I figured it would be the same experience as before. text: I went in a little while back just looking for a mask for cold weather riding.  I walked in and didn't see anyone nor was I approached.  That's not a big deal, but after not finding what I was looking for I started looking for an employee.  I heard people laughing in the back and found all the employees laughing and carrying on.  I stepped in and asked about the mask, after they all went silent as if I had interrupted their important meeting, one guy turned and pointed me in a direction instead of showing me where they were.  I just walked out the door.  I realize it was a small item, but that was incredibly poor customer service.  I did not feel welcome.

name: TJ
text: Stopped in at Sppedzone and asked about a sxs that has a MSRP of about $17,000.00 and the salesman said that's about $20,000.00 out the door. But, on Speedzones website it was $15,540.00 and I brought that to his attention and then he said it will be about $18,000.00  out the door. I said why didn't you say that when I asked and he said you have to tell us the internet price to get it for that. I said that is ridiculous. I will be going somewhere else. He called me a little while later and said I could get it for $15,640.00 out the door. I ended up going to Auburn to buy it because I feel Speedzone is a RIP off. The place in Auburn was straight forward when I called and asked the price out the door.  Speedzone  also quoted me a windshield for $512.00, that on Hondas website has a MSRP of $479.00. So be aware and know how much stuff is before you go here.

name: brandon cook
text: (EVERY ONE MUST READ )DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH SPEEDZONE OF OXFORD.  They advertised a sxs for one price but wrote it up for more than they advertised.not talking about the add on like extended warranty or prep fees.im talking the price on the tag for the unit. Save your self some time and money go to Motorcycle sports or Talladega cycle. Speedzone is already over priced. They sold my wife a used rzr for 2500 more than what it would cost new and it was bone stock.(extra b.s) so after taking our Polaris to have serviced thru there speed pass.this is ruffy 1 year later cause hey I paid for why not use it. Well let's start off by saying this is the 3rd time the ploaris has been in for service.so dropped it off on a Tuesday and they tell me it will be ready on the next day. So the next day rolls around and I do not get a call to come pick it up. So the next day Thursday I call them and ask if it's ready to be picked up. They informed me yes it is ready. So let's load the trailer and go to pick it up.once getting there they hand me paper work and he goes to find my sxs. He is walking around everywhere in the shop to find this sxs. So I look at the paperwork and it is paperwork for a Honda i used to own not the Polaris so I tell him it's the ploaris not the Honda due to the Honda being in Texas now. They then go on to tell me that they just completeld the work on my Honda.so that's when I decided to let him know that it's in Texas. But yet they did the service and paperwork.once we found our ploaris we were told it would be ready the next day. So moving on to next day we get there to pick up the machine thsy has 150 hrs on it and they only do a 25 hr service on the machine. They cant tell me how many services it has had even tho they did it. So there goes our warranty  and extended warranty. Man this place is the biggest joke ever. For anyone to buy from them and give a good review. They must be standing by your side telling you what to write before you leave there store.

name: Andrew Zinn
text: I want to thank Jennifer and all the staff at SpeedZi\one once again.  I was very pleased with my Honda PCX 150, but felt like it was time to upgrade to a larger, more powerful ride.  I liked the Honda DCT series of bikes.  I was keen  on the idea of having manual AND automatic transmissions on the same bike.  I felt this would be a logical transition from moped to a cruiser style bike.  Jennifer and the helpful financing department were able to help me trade in my moped and put me on a brand new Honda CTX 700.  I got on the bike and got used to it.  I rode and rode and had to make myself go home because I was having such a hell of a time riding.  If you're looking to make a change in what you're riding, or want to start riding period, I strongly recommend you visit Jennifer in sales and the other friendly and helpful staff at SpeedZone of Oxford.

Throttle response was great an more power but that's not why i brought it there. So i went home looked at the carbs and the funnel of the carb was cracked. Its suppose to be new parts. Took it back the next morning told him everything an showed him the crack his response "how did you see that". My opinion, if you have a real issue with your bike take it somewhere else, but if you need tires or something small, by all means go ahead. Once they fix this ill never go back for anything other than riding gear or the snack machine. I wish i would have taken the 2.6 review on Google more serious.

name: David Bartlett
text:
I just relocated to Alabama from Texas when I contacted, Ronnie.  I had been having problems with finding someone to work on my bike.  I have a ’95 Honda VT1100c Shadow.  No one wanted to work on it because of it’s age & my regular mechanic had closed up shop.  When I spoke to, Ronnie I explained what I wanted him to do.  I asked him how long would it take to complete the job.  He told him that it would be two weeks.  I agreed to that.  He came out to my house in late July to pick up my bike & take it to his shop.
I waited the two weeks & gave him al call.  He said that he was still working on another bike & he was waiting for parts to come in.  I said, that was fine, I can wait for a few more weeks.  Two more weeks came about & he still hasn’t gotten to it.  So, I just gave up & bought another bike in September.  I finally got a call from him on October 10th & 12:38 pm.  He said that he got it done.  I called him back & asked him how much it was, he said the total was $865.44.   I told him I would have to pick it up in a month. He agreed.  When I got there on November the 23rd to pick it up, he had flattened the rear tire.  He said  he broke the valve stem.  He told me he was going to charge me $75.00 to replace the stem that he broke.  I then asked him if we could start it, he said again, no.  The bike did have to be bottle fed.  So, I took it home.  When I got home I bottle fed it, it wouldn’t start.  I called him & he said that it ran when he had it.  So, I asked him if he could look at it & see if he could figure out what was wrong.  He said that it would be two weeks & he would get $80.00 an hour to fix it.  Keep in mind, I just gave him the previous day, $865.00 in cash.  So, I took the carbs back off.  The only thing he changed was the diaphragms. The main jets, slow jets all were corroded & stopped up. He had the float heights all off.  He even used rubber hose for fuel line.  I called him back to ask for half a refund on it. I called him out on what he did.  When I told him that the jets were filthy & the carb bodies were filthy he stuttered & then told me that I am not getting sh*t back and hung up.  I wouldn’t let this man work on anything.  The review on here before mine had a bad experience & they were there when I picked up my bike.  If I could give it negative starts if I could. These pictures below show what I got for my money. You can see that the bottom of the carbs are green & the jets are old & stopped up.

name: Vickie Thrower-Mills
text:
We took our 2001 Indian Chief that had been setting up for 7 years to this shop.  Big Mistake.  He charged us $3500 plus to fix it.  He was clearly aware that it had set up.  The first time we went to get it, It would not start and the lights wouldn't work.  He ask how long has this gas been in here. My husband said 7 years remember you were supposed to drain the tank for me.  He even wrote it sat up for 7 years on the receipt.  He painted the front  fender with paint that didn't match.  He put a used rear tire on it and called it a new one.  It had dirt and clay mud on it and the bike wouldn't start so where would the mud come from on a new tire? .  We left it with him for obvious reasons.  My husband ask him to replace the bushing in the handle bars since we were leaving it anyway.We paid him in the beginning to change the light covers.  He charged us twice the original one he ordered we found in the saddle bags.    My husband starts home on it today.  The brake light would not go off and the mirror was just spinning. You would think he would have saw that when replacing the bushing in the handlebars. My husband gets to Arab while driving the brand new war bonnet on the fender fell off.  Oil is leaking from a bike that he supposedly changed the oil and fixed the clutch on it.  We paid this man 3700 plus and he didn't take enough pride in his work to even wipe the dust off the bike.  I was using his shop rag to do that while we were waiting to get it running last week.  He literally took it out of my hand.  When I first met him i told my husband he seems like a good Christian person.  Boy was I wrong he might be a Christian.  I have no Idea but good is far from the truth.  We are very upset with the way we were ripped off.
We took our bike to another shop because it was obvious that Ronnie did not change the tires, the battery, fix the carburetor or anything we ask him and paid him to do. They could not believe that anyone would say the changed tires when they were literally rotten around the rim because it had set up for 7 years. He really screwed us out of 3700.00 He is a dishonest man. The Battery was 7 years old yet he said it was new. Along with the tires.
